name: Tuna and Macaroni Salad
author: Beth Urban
summary: This tuna and macaroni salad is a family favorite throughout the year. I like to make this the night before, refrigerate, and let the flavors blend together. Serve over lettuce or as a side dish.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook bow-tie pasta at a boil, stirring occasionally, until almost tender, about 10 minutes
Add peas and continue cooking for 2 minutes
Drain pasta and peas and chill quickly by rinsing with cold water
Transfer pasta and peas to a large bowl
Mix in tuna, celery, green onion, dill, and carrot until well blended
Mix mayonnaise, mustard, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl
